title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

For Identification: Do not accept primary or secondary, but quaternary or quinary is allowed if mentioned with tertiary.

Two points are earned for one correct identification and one description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly identify nor describe the economic sector that becomes dominant when a country deindustrializes and restructures from an industrial to a postindustrial economy:
The response correctly identifies or describes the economic sector that becomes dominant when a country deindustrializes and restructures from an industrial to a postindustrial economy:
The response correctly identifies and describes the economic sector that becomes dominant when a country deindustrializes and restructures from an industrial to a postindustrial economy:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Each point must be from different categories.

Two points are earned for two correct descriptions.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the following ways that countries transitioning to a postindustrial economy utilize the international division of labor:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways countries transitioning to a postindustrial economy utilize the international division of labor:
The response correctly describes two of the following ways countries transitioning to a postindustrial economy utilize the international division of labor:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following ways that the roles of women in the paid labor force of developed countries change as a result of the transition to a postindustrial economy:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways that the roles of women in the paid labor force of developed countries change as a result of the transition to a postindustrial economy:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Do not accept schools or K-12 school buildings, which are banned on brownfields.

Two points are earned for two correct descriptions.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the following ways that brownfields can be redeveloped in postindustrial cities:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways that brownfields can be redeveloped in postindustrial cities:
The response correctly describes two of the following ways that brownfields can be redeveloped in postindustrial cities:
